intro: Gnidia usinjensis, commonly known as the Usinje wild quince, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rhamnaceae. It is native to the eastern regions of the Democratic Republic of the Congo and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within dense forests. Its leaves are simple, ovate, and have a slightly rough texture. Gnidia usinjensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological significance in its habitat.
